knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```

```{r download data}
nyc_squirrels <- readr::read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2019/2019-10-29/nyc_squirrels.csv")

```

## Cleaning data

It seems that few duplicated values exists in this data.

```{r cleaning data}
nyc_squirrels %>% 
  count(unique_squirrel_id, sort = TRUE)

nyc_squirrels %>% 
  group_by(unique_squirrel_id) %>% 
  filter(n() > 1) %>% 
  arrange(unique_squirrel_id)

clean_squirrels <- nyc_squirrels %>% 
  group_by(unique_squirrel_id) %>% 
  slice(1)

```

Only 5 duplicated rows have been removed

```{r}
nyc_squirrels %>% 
  count(approaches, indifferent, runs_from, sort = TRUE)
```
